p: Compound 6 b was prepared from 4-cyanobenzaldehyde 4 b (0.058 g, 0.44 mmol), 2–(3,4-diaminophenyl)-3,4,5,6-tetrahydropyrimidin-1-ium chloride 3 (0.100 g, 0.44 mmol), and sodium metabisulfite (0.084 g, 0.44 mmol) in dimethyl sulfoxide (1 ml). The resulting free base was converted into salt as described below to obtained 0.075 g (50.3%) of beige powder; m.p. >300 °C; 1H NMR (600 MHz, DMSO-d 6) δ 14.20 (bs, 1H), 10.04 (s, 2H), 8.47 (d, J = 7.7 Hz, 2H), 8.11 (s, 1H), 8.06 (d, J = 7.8 Hz, 2H), 7.83 (d, J = 7.8 Hz, 1H), 7.62 (d, J = 8.0 Hz, 1H), 3.52 (m, 4H), 2.01 (m, 2H); 13 C NMR (75 MHz, DMSO-d 6) δ 160.1, 152.8, 134.1, 133.5, 128.0, 123.0, 122.4, 119.0, 113.0, 39.3, 18.4; Analysis calcd for C 18H 16ClN 5: C, 64.00; H, 4.77; N, 20.73%; Found: C, 64.03; H, 4.74; N, 20.71%.
